subject: Re: Reminder: Order #SSN3385, how did it go?
description_text:
Hello,

I received haptic motors, but when I connect power supply it sparks and power supply rebooting. Also when connected to only USB control box heats up a lot. Sending a link to a video: https://www.icloud.com/iclouddrive/03ezTEKsH5mJcl29C7z-Itjjw#SIMSONN

I think control box is broken. Can you please send me a new one under warranty?

Thank you,
Visvaldas

> On 10 Dec 2025, at 15:45, SIMSONN <no-reply@loox.io> wrote:
> 
> 
> Hello Visvaldas,
> 
> We would be grateful if you shared how things look and feel. Your review helps us and the community that supports us, and it only takes a few seconds.
> 
> Simsonn Plus X Racing Simulation Pedal with Haptic Reactor Optional
> Plus X P3-H3 / Black / without Baseplate

conversations.body_text: Hi Visvaldas Stonkus,  Alright, please provide your order number, contact name, shipping address, and phone number. We will send you a new main control box tomorrow (Monday).

Hello,

Okay, attaching my details at the end of the email.

Unfortunately I have one more issue. I played one game with this new shifter and it went more than it should into second gear, it got stuck and disconnected from the PC. Button lights keep working, but does not recognise by the PC no more. I removed bottom screws to check inside and I found that the pole went more than it should have and broke the electronics board. I believe the problem is that the stick is too short and it was barely held by the H pattern, it wasn’t long enough to hold the stick in place. I did not use force, you can see from the scratches of H pattern that stick is very short. You can see from the video I have attached to this email below or the image.

Can you please send me a replacement together with the new control box for the pedals?

https://www.icloud.com/iclouddrive/06d00nnxlfPkEKGJkH6v_ZxQw#shifter￼
My order number is SSN3385
Contact name: Visvaldas Stonkus
Shipping address: Butvydo g. 28, 14259, Vilnius, Lithuania
Phone number: +37063676280

Thank you,
Visvaldas

>
Hi Visvaldas Stonkus,  Alright, I will send you a ProX Ultra control box along with a shifter board for you to replace.

I can replace shifter board but it will get damaged again because shifter stick is not long enough to stay in place. With just a little bit of force I can move the stick from second gear to 4th gear or from second gear forward which break the board. Thanks,Visvaldas

I recorded a video to show you that the shifter does not hold the stick in place.
https://www.icloud.com/iclouddrive/0a1F19eT5qdAUNpc7EtedSyyA#IMG_2544


Thanks,

Visvaldas
Hi Visvaldas Stonkus,  I am unable to access your iCloud; it prompts for a login. Could you please send the link via Google Drive and set the appropriate access permissions?

Okay, I’ve uploaded to google drive. Here’s the link: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1_H9vSbZv5EbcEY2oiLvChmMoSe0r-9Dw/view?usp=sharing


>

Hi Visvaldas Stonkus,  I have forwarded this to the production team for inspection to check whether the wrong size standoffs were installed on the base plate motherboard, causing the board to sit too low. At the moment, only two standoffs are visible, and it is possible that the standoffs are too short.

There’s all four standoffs for the board and I don’t think it can be higher, because of the USB port that goes out. If board was higher usb port would not fit into the case which is why I think the fix is longer metal stick.

Waiting for your answer, I’m waiting for the pedals control board so I could use it, that’s the most urgent for me, please.

Thank you,
Visvaldas

>

Hi Visvaldas Stonkus,  Our mechanical engineer will first check the model and print an extended rod for testing. If the test result is acceptable, we will send you an additional improved rod, along with a replacement mainboard.

Hello, can you please update me with the status?

Thanks,
Visvaldas

>
Hi Visvaldas Stonkus,  Our samples will only be back for testing tomorrow. I will get back to you then.

Hi Visvaldas Stonkus,       Regarding the shifter issue, this problem does not occur on our current production units. Based on our assessment, it is likely that the rod you received has an incorrect length, which would be a quality-related issue. To resolve this, we can send you the following three replacement parts:    One PlusX control box    One shifter PCB    One shifter rod    Please let us know if this solution is acceptable to you.

Okay, it doesn’t seem complex to assemble it. If you think all will fit together well you can sent the parts and I will replace, just please make sure to include new plastic piece for H pattern as it got damaged together.
￼

>

Hi, Have you sent it?

Thanks,
Visvaldas

>

Hello, have you sent the replacement parts?

Thanks,
Visvaldas

>
